item.description:
About

My name is Isabelle, but I mostly go by Isa. I’m a trans girlthing who enjoys programming, speedcubing, reading, and playing chess. I’m also an avid Linux user. I like listening to trap music, my favorite artists are Ghostemane, Warlord Colossus, and Kill Dyll. Professionally, I’m a DevOps engineer in the agriculture tech field.

Contact

You can reach me on Discord at patchydev (preferred), or via e-mail at patchydev@proton.me.

Projects

Warning: bad, poorly documented code lies ahead

I like to do silly things with computers, here’s some of my favorite:

Image Replacer Proxy

This is quite possibly the most cursed thing I’ve ever done on a computer. It acts as a proxy that replaces some percent of images to an image. It’s funny. Made in Rust and Python. Good luck figuring out how to compile it lol

Theo

A chess engine/library written in Rust… that doesn’t fully work. Currently procrastinating a complete refactor.
